title: U.S., Gulf Allies Blacklist Islamic State Financial Network
summary: Sanctions target businesses accused of helping finance terrorist group. WASHINGTON-The U.S. has joined six other nations in sanctioning a financial network linked to the Islamic State terrorist group and its affiliates, blocking any of their assets in the U.S., the Treasury Department said.

title: Police Officer Quickly Drew Gun on Crying Floyd
summary: Body camera footage from two officers is released for the first time. MINNEAPOLIS-The Memorial Day encounter between George Floyd and police escalated quickly after one of the officers drew his weapon on a crying and increasingly flustered Mr. Floyd, according to police body camera footage made public for the first time Wednesday.

title: Coronavirus Cases Rise in Several States; Oklahoma Governor Tests Positive
summary: Forty-six states had a seven-day average of new cases higher than their average during the past two weeks. Oklahoma Gov. Kevin Stitt became the latest politician to test positive for the new coronavirus, as rising numbers of cases in more U.S. states suggested the pandemic was continuing to spread.

title: The Biden Election Stimulus
summary: Another jobless benefit increase would keep unemployment high.. Democrats and Republicans are starting to negotiate over another huge spending bill, and the question for Republicans is why they would want to repeat the biggest mistake from the last one? That's precisely what they would do if they follow Treasury Secretary Steve Mnuchin and extend the federal jobless-insurance bonus up to 100% of lost wages.

title: A Loss for Europe's Antitrust Abusers
summary: An EU court rules that Apple didn't get special treatment from Ireland.. High-tax European governments would love nothing better than to milk profitable American tech giants for all the revenue they can get. Efforts to do it directly by passing new tax laws have failed so far. And on Wednesday a European Union court slapped down an especially frivolous attempt to impose such taxes through the back door.

title: Trump's Virus Non-Message
summary: The Navarro-Fauci spat adds to the perception of dysfunction.. President Trump's coronavirus management ratings have been plummeting (67% disapproved in an ABC/Ipsos poll last week) and if a better public-relations plan is in the works, it's not apparent. Wednesday's news on this front was an op-ed by Peter Navarro, a top economic adviser, attacking the judgment of Anthony Fauci of the National Institutes of Health. The White House formally disavowed the op-ed, but it came after the White House social-media director posted an anti-Fauci cartoon on Sunday.

title: Show Unions the Money
summary: L.A. teachers lay down their terms for returning to the classroom.. title: 2020 Gives New Meaning to 'Viral Campaign'

title: 'The Rise of the G.I. Army, 1940-1941' Review: The Race to Get Ready to Fight
summary: As war raged in Europe, America went about building an army that could join the ﬁght, if need be. So many obstacles, so little time.. On Sept. 1, 1939, Nazi Germany shattered the precarious peace of Europe with its 1.5 million-man Blitzkrieg invasion of Poland. On that fateful day, the U.S. Army numbered fewer than 200,000 men, a force smaller than that of Portugal. Equipment and tactics were obsolete, units scattered and at half-strength, and most officers valued horse cavalry more than tanks.

title: Oh Yes, Ban the Redskins
summary: I give up. It's time to ban a lot of really terrible sports-team names. I have a long list.. For now, the Washington Redskins are just the Washington Something or Others, a team with no name. After holding out for years against the inertial forces of political correctness, the Washington football team caved. Hmm, maybe "caved" is inappropriate language now. They gave up.

title: Walmart, Kroger to Require Shoppers to Wear Masks in All U.S. Stores
summary: Retail giants join ranks of businesses and states leaders requiring masks to combat spread of coronavirus. title: Hudson's Bay CFO Set to Depart
summary: Ed Record took a leave of medical absence last year but returned to the position in December. Hudson's Bay Co.'s chief financial officer is set to leave the business following a deal to take the company private and the departure of its chief executive.

summary: Carrier said travel demand is falling again as U.S. coronavirus cases climb. American Airlines Group Inc. told 25,000 workers that their jobs are at risk after federal aid expires Oct. 1, as air-travel demand falls again amid climbing coronavirus case numbers.

summary: Next big test could come in Kansas, where GOP Senate candidates see a potential presidential pick as being decisive. title: NYPD Officers Injured During Brooklyn Bridge Protests
summary: Confrontations occur between Black Lives Matter and pro-police demonstrators. title: Overdose Deaths Rise, May Reach Record Level, Federal Data Show
summary: Fatalities in 2019 follow brief one-year decline in U.S. drug crisis. U.S. fatal drug overdoses rose last year, new federal data show, reversing a one-year-decline and indicating that another public-health crisis was worsening as the coronavirus pandemic was poised to begin.

summary: Updated National Environmental Policy Act will impose deadlines on reviews. President Trump said Wednesday that his administration has completed its update to the National Environmental Policy Act, including changes that will mandate deadlines for completing environmental reviews.

title: Neiman Marcus Bankruptcy Watchdog Says Company Must Justify Bonuses
summary: A Justice Department official says the retailer needs to show that management improved the business. A Justice Department official said Neiman Marcus Group Chief Executive Geoffroy van Raemdonck and other top executives don't deserve up to $10 million in bonuses unless the bankrupt company can prove the recipients boosted earnings.

title: Remote Interns Long for More Face Time
summary: "Regardless of how good everything is, it's really not going to be like that physical experience, you know?". Fifty-three percent of students said they were most concerned about feelings of solitude on the job, according to the market research firm Propeller Insights, which surveyed 1,003 college students on behalf of college career site Handshake in late June. Interns working remotely this summer are looking for ways to communicate actively and get to know their colleagues and fellow interns. For some, that means over-communicating with their managers and trying to schedule Zoom or phone calls rather than just talking by Slack or email. For others, it means participating in occasional company-led, in-person social events for interns. It's important for managers to communicate clearly with interns about their expectations, "so that you're not experiencing burnout and your new employees aren't overwhelmed," says Priti Khare, a spokeswoman at Handshake.

title: Tax Day: What to Do if You're Not Sure Your Return Went Through
summary: The I.R.S. is delayed, so the best advice is to just wait. The I.R.S. is currently dealing with a backlog of tax returns, so it's possible you filed your taxes weeks ago but still haven't received your refund. If you filed a return online, see if you have a notice saying your return was accepted. If you never received one, then it's possible the return didn't go through so you should try to refile. But if you have the receipt and it's still delayed, there are also other factors that might've delayed your refund, like incomplete bank deposit information. Unfortunately, the pandemic has delayed the I.R.S. process for dealing with these issues. You can use this "Where's My Refund?" tool to check the status of your refund, but if you have your receipt, the short answer is: wait.

title: Biden Expands Lead as Trump's Approval Drops
summary: Voters increasingly dislike president's performance during coronavirus pandemic, but majority of voters back his handling of economy. They might be innocently carrying the spawn of Satan. But you usually know which is which and who is who.

summary: Science provides a direction and can offer an evaluation of the potentially deadly risks and negligible benefits associated with a consumer product.. Regarding James R. title: Anguilla Sought Comfort Under British Crown Again
summary: In 1980 Anguilla was allowed to formally secede from St. Kitts and become a separate crown colony.. "For all the incompetence and corruption" (by native post-imperial governments), he writes, "nobody rejoined the Empire." There is at least one counterexample to that: the "Anguillia Revolution."

title: Streaming Overload: Six Ways to Create the Ultimate TV Watch List
summary: NBCUniversal's streaming service Peacock is here, adding to the 100,000 hours of TV already on your screens. Here's how to navigate the flood of old and new content.. Peacock, the subscription video service from NBCUniversal had its grand opening Wednesday after a three-month test run for customers of parent company Comcast. It's stocked with 20,000 hours worth of movies and television, and joins more big-box and boutique streamers than you can count on two hands, including Apple TV+, Disney+ and HBO Max, all of which opened their virtual doors in the last nine months.

summary: A travel journalist who'd lost her sense of wonder chasing $1,000-a-night hotels exiles herself to the Russian hinterland-and finds her spirit renewed. THE CHUYSKY TRAKT is one of the world's great drives. This 600-mile-long highway links Novosibirsk, the de facto capital of Siberia, to the border town of Kosh-Agach, with the road's final stages winding through the humps and swells, the wide plateaus and crumpled ridgelines, of Russia's Altai Mountains.

title: Google to Invest $4.5 Billion in India's Jio Platforms
summary: American tech giant takes 7.7% stake in India's biggest telecom company. Alphabet Inc.'s Google will invest about $4.5 billion in Jio Platforms Ltd, the company behind India's largest telecom provider by subscribers, giving the American tech giant a powerful partner for its plans to get hundreds of millions more people online.

title: Cash Crunch at Retailers Stings Suppliers During Pandemic
summary: Nike, Columbia Sportswear and Samsonite take higher bad-debt charges as retailers struggle to pay for goods. Makers of apparel and accessories are getting pinched as the retailers they supply struggle to pay for goods, adding to the pain caused by the coronavirus pandemic and threatening the viability of many small and midsize businesses.

title: Legendary Broadway Casting Director Is Retiring
summary: For almost four decades, Jay Binder helped cast shows including 'Lion King,' 'Lost in Yonkers' and 'Gentleman's Guide to Love & Murder'. Early in his career as a theatrical casting director, Jay Binder was asked by the playwright Edward Albee to find a one-armed actor for a production.

title: Border Officials Didn't Follow Guidelines on Migrant Children's Health Care, Report Finds
summary: Government Accountability Office said violations by Customs and Border Protection included keeping children longer, in crowded conditions, than its rules allow. WASHINGTON-U.S. Customs and Border Protection doesn't consistently follow its own guidelines governing medical care of migrant children in its custody and chose to ignore a recommendation from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention to give the flu vaccine to children, a new report by the Government Accountability Office found.

title: Violent Reckoning for Ethiopia's Nobel Laureate Leader
summary: Abiy Ahmed came to power with hopes to break open Ethiopia's one-party state, but is now accused of a power grab and brutally putting down dissent. Targeted killings, deadly street protests, a postponed election and rising regional tensions over control of the Nile river are destabilizing Ethiopia, posing a stern challenge to the reformist leader of Africa's second-most populous nation just a year after he won the Nobel Peace Prize.

title: Take a Hike, in Style
summary: Celebrate summer in with bonfires, mysticism and bewitching dresses that can weather long tramps through the hills.

title: Battle Over Bridge Collapse Costs Italy's Benetton Family Its Highways Business
summary: Toll-road operator Autostrade to pay $3.9 billion, covering compensation to victims of 2018 Genoa disaster and cost of new bridge. The Benetton family, one of Italy's most famous business dynasties, bowed to political pressure to surrender its most valuable asset, the company that runs much of the country's highway network, as a belated consequence of the deadly collapse of a bridge in Genoa in 2018.

title: Eleven of Our Favorite Things This July
summary: From Senegalese baskets to wooden essentials handcrafted in London to sophisticated sipping rums, a collection of objects and experiences to savor this summer.. Graff's threads collection gives bold form to the connectivity of the modern world with a high jewelry necklace of intertwined gems. Featuring 41 oval-shaped blue sapphires and 405 pavé and baguette diamonds set on crisscrossing white-gold bars, the piece is meant to echo the intricate intersections of everyday life. Price upon request; graff.com. -Alexander Fisher

title: Trump Issues Threats to States and Cities, Then Backs Off
summary: The president has often made threats to local governments-including on school funding and coronavirus restrictions-that are beyond his power to carry out. WASHINGTON-At a White House news conference this spring, President Trump laid out an expansive view of his authority over states as they grappled with the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Women's Careers Could Take Long-Term Hit From Coronavirus Pandemic
summary: Most Popular News. Juggling work and family has never been easy. Under pandemic conditions, some women say it is proving impossible.

title: Notre Dame, and Everyone Else, Is Feeling Bleak About College Football
summary: Even the most powerful forces in college football feel powerless to keep the sport on course as coronavirus cases surge across the U.S.. Notre Dame athletic director Jack Swarbrick is one of the most powerful figures in college football. But as the coming season slowly falls apart, even the game's most powerful figures feel powerless to stop it.

title: Universities Plan Robust Covid-19 Testing for Returning Students
summary: Public-health experts, citing rising coronavirus cases across the U.S., worry about a strained supply chain. Universities, seeking to bring students back to campus this fall during the coronavirus pandemic, are laying out reopening plans that rely heavily on their health departments arranging widespread, frequent testing of students, faculty and staff.

title: Japan's Subsidies for Tourists Spread Coronavirus Fears
summary: Promoting economic growth or a second Covid-19 wave? Some lawmakers want to call off the $10 billion plan.. TOKYO-Japan's capital is going through a resurgence of coronavirus infections. Many parts of the country have virtually none. And the government is kicking off a $10 billion tourism promotion next week to encourage urbanites to roam across the country.

title: ESG Investing in the Pandemic Shows Power of Luck
summary: Multiplicity of environmental, social and governance grading schemes sows confusion. Does ESG investing make money? The trouble with asking about environmental, social and governance investing is that it isn't a thing that can be measured-or rather, it is lots of things all measured differently. That hasn't stopped the U.S. Department of Labor proposing a new regulation to prevent pension funds from using an ESG approach unless they expect it to make more money.

title: Why Your Tax Refund May Be Late This Year
summary: A Q&A for taxpayers who have filed returns but haven't gotten refunds or had their checks cashed. Sandra Martensen is worried. She and her husband mailed their paper tax return to the Internal Revenue Service on April 7, claiming a refund of about $1,600. Since then she has heard nothing from the IRS. She has tried repeatedly to get information from the IRS's Where's My Refund online tool and phone number, but both say there's no record of the tax return.

title: Rare-Earth Metals Firm MP Materials to Go Public via Blank-Check Company
summary: The firm has struck a deal to merge with Fortress Value Acquisition, which will take it to market. Rare-earth minerals producer MP Materials Corp. will go public through a blank-check company, joining the growing wave of companies doing so.

title: At Evercore, a Dean of Wall Street and Washington Elevates New Leaders
summary: Roger Altman names Ralph Schlosstein, John S. Weinberg co-CEOs, co-Chairmen. Roger Altman founded Evercore Inc. in 1995 after a long career on Wall Street and Washington. He's now laying the groundwork to make sure it thrives after he exits.

title: Nissan Captures a Bit of Tesla Magic With Electric SUV
summary: Japanese auto maker's shares rise more than 7% on plans to sell Ariya EV next year starting at $40,000. TOKYO- Nissan Motor Co. finally captured for itself some of the investor excitement over electric vehicles, unveiling a new model that helped its shares rise more than 7%.

title: Korea's Radical Housing-Boom Crackdown Is a Sign of Things to Come
summary: Plans to more aggressively tax homeowners with multiple expensive properties are the latest in a barrage of efforts. The government of South Korea plans to sharply raise capital-gains taxes for home flipping and ramp up taxes on corporate property to cool a price boom. That should have property investors looking over their shoulders-and not just in Korea's expensive capital, Seoul.

title: Coronavirus-Gear Broker Used Political Ties to Sell Goods to States, Data Show
summary: Blue Flame Medical is facing investigations for failing to deliver millions of dollars of promised Covid-19 supplies. A former political fundraiser reached deals to sell roughly $630 million in Covid-19 medical supplies to government entities after using Republican political connections to facilitate business, according to emails and contract documents.

title: World's Oldest Stock Market Has New Tech Cluster
summary: Europe is no longer a wasteland for internet stocks, and three of the most active are in Amsterdam. Where is Europe's tech capital? Cynics that say nowhere haven't been watching Amsterdam.

title: Why Arizona Wasn't Ready for Its Coronavirus Surge
summary: State leaders didn't prepare when cases were low and are now struggling to cope; 'Everyone needed to do more'. In the state with the highest per-capita rate of Covid-19 cases in America over the past week, Arizonans are waiting up to eight hours in the broiling hot sun to get tested. A metropolitan area of a million people was down to 17 free ICU beds Tuesday. A top health official in the largest county said the coronavirus is now so widespread that contact tracing is almost ineffective.

title: Coronavirus Has Americans Hooked on Canned Tuna, and Producers Are Playing Catch-Up
summary: People have been buying more canned tuna during the economic downturn, in part because it's a cheap protein. HONG KONG-Tuna fish has surged in popularity thanks to pantry loading during the coronavirus pandemic, but producers of the canned fish are dealing with higher prices and other challenges that are making it difficult to keep up with the increased demand.

title: Companies Worry EU Court Ruling Could Disrupt Global Data Transfers
summary: Judges are scrutinizing a widely used legal mechanism for moving data between countries. Companies that do business in Europe are worried that a long-anticipated court ruling this week could disrupt how they transfer personal data to countries around the world.

title: U.S. Economy Bolstered by Appetite for Cars, Homes
summary: Historically low interest rates are luring in auto and home buyers with higher incomes than service-sector workers hardest-hit by pandemic.

title: Coelius Capital Founder Is Latest AngelList Investor to Graduate to VC Fund
summary: Coelius Capital, founded by Zach Coelius, raises $45 million, with Industry Ventures as its sole limited partner. AngelList has become a popular website for startups to raise capital from investors without having to pitch to traditional venture firms. Now some investors who have built a track record on the platform are raising their own traditional venture funds.

title: Tuberville Beats Sessions in Alabama Senate GOP Primary
summary: In Maine, Democratic winner Sara Gideon will face Republican Sen. Susan Collins this fall. Former college-football coach Tommy Tuberville won one of the most closely watched primary races of the year, easily beating former Attorney General Jeff Sessions in the Alabama Republican Senate runoff and ending his bid for a political comeback.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Kansas GOP Congressman Steve Watkins Faces Voter Fraud Charges
summary: Mr. Watkins denies wrongdoing, calls timing of charges 'suspicious'. Minutes before a Republican congressman took the debate stage in Kansas to defend his U.S. House seat, news broke that he had been charged with voter fraud.

title: What To Know About The Ivy League Canceling Sports This Fall
summary: Other conferences could follow suit in the coming weeks. The Ivy League's decision to postpone football and other sports until at least the start of 2021 comes less than two months before the college football season is supposed to begin. Some or all sports could hold their seasons in the spring, but the Ivy League presidents said it depends on the spread of the virus.

title: Trump Signs Hong Kong Sanctions Bill, Pivots to Criticizing Biden
summary: Law requires sanctions on Chinese officials who crack down Hong Kong residents' rights. WASHINGTON-President Trump said he signed into law a bipartisan sanctions bill to punish Chinese officials over Beijing's crackdown on Hong Kong, in an hour-long press conference at the White House dominated by criticisms of Joe Biden, his presumptive 2020 election rival.

title: Surge in Covid-19 Cases Forces States to Tighten Rules
summary: Countries where virus seemed to be contained impose new restrictions to combat outbreaks. Coronavirus cases in the U.S. continued to grow in dozens of states, as some officials instituted fresh containment measures and others examined how reopening plans failed to anticipate surges in new infections and related hospitalizations.

title: Dunford Won't Lead Panel Overseeing Coronavirus Relief Funds
summary: One panel member has raised concerns that the absence of a chairperson and full-time staff is hindering the commission's work. WASHINGTON-Retired Gen. Joe Dunford has dropped out of consideration to lead a congressional panel overseeing $500 billion in coronavirus relief funds, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Has Covid Brought an End to Helicopter Parenting?
summary: The pressures of the pandemic have forced families to abandon the hypervigilant approach popular since the 1990s. That could help kids become more independent, but also comes with risks.. Kim Lucasti recently made a parenting decision she never would have permitted before the coronavirus pandemic: She let her 14-year-old daughter ride a bike into town without an adult alongside her.

title: Women and Men Age Differently-in More Ways Than Just Longevity
summary: Resume Subscription. Lois and Milt Michaels hosted a dinner party for 15 friends last year at their home in Pittsburgh.
